official-title.#text:
To establish the Federal Accounting Standards Advisory Board as an independent establishment to
			 develop Federal financial accounting concepts and standards and provide
			 guidance to users of Federal financial information, and for other
			 purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

text.#text: The members appointed by the
One representative from the Financial Accounting Foundation (or a successor organization).

Two representatives from an organization that nationally represents the interests of the certified
			 public accountant profession by—

serving as an advocate before legislative and regulatory entities, public interest organizations,
			 and professional organizations;

developing standards for audits of nonpublic entities and guidelines for services of certified
			 public accountants;
providing professional tools and training to certified public accountants; and

monitoring and enforcing compliance with technical and ethical standards for certified public
			 accountants.
